reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have recently returned from a weeks break at Thoresby Hall and it was fabulous in every way. Accommodation, food, restaurants, entertainment all first class. The grounds were wonderful and the staff in every area couldnt do enough to help you. My husband was taken ill for the last couple of days of our trip (pre-existing condition, nothing to do with the hotel) and everyone was so kind and helpful. A special mention must go to the young girls on reception who in my opinion went that extra mile to support and help in every way possible with my husbands illness. Well done Thoresby, you are a credit to the hotel trade.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first visit to Thoresby Hall although not our first with Warners. Our room was one of the Historic Rooms. We found the room was perfect it was overlooking the gardens which were in the process of being planted up, the Hall was beautiful and we enjoyed our stay. The only comment we would make is that unlike Littlecote it does not have allocated tables for meals and we found this annoying. At Littlecote we had our own designated table and waiter which made the stay so much easier as the waiter got to know your likes and dislikes; however at Thoresby it was not as personal. Understand that this is hopefully going to change. We would like to go again when the weather is better to take advantage of the walks.
reviews.title: First visit to Thoresby Hall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights and enjoyed the full hospitality of the hotel. Reception was busy on arrival but the staff were efficient and helpful. The historic room we had booked exceeded expectations and was worth the additional charge. We dined at the Blue Room on the first night and the Italian restaurant the second . At both we had first rate attentive service from Sophie in the Blue Room and Ryan in the Italian. Food was excellent. (Try the Veal at the Italian) In the day we swam and used the sauna and steam room in the Spa and strolled through the grounds (when it wasn't raining ) In the evenings we danced and watched the high quality entertainment. The hall offers plenty to do with a full programme of activities or you can just relax and enjoy the historical setting and the surrounding countryside. A thoroughly enjoyable short break
reviews.title: Excellence at Thoresby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay, while most of it was fine, we did notice a difference to previous visits. We booked an Historic Room on all occasions, this time though no chocolates or fruit as standard. The toiletries were not good quality as before (Penhaligons) but a cheap version made in China. A food trolley was left all day in the corridor (from the night before) yuk! Entertainment was not up to the usual great standards. We did however enjoy the WONDERFUL Falconry display (Jacob & his Dad). Please take part if you can, you won't be disappointed, it was truly the best display we've ever been to. Everyone was actively encouraged to handle and fly the birds, no big ego trip for the people that ran it (unlike previous displayers!) Staff were great, and although very busy, the food was good too.

description: A magnificent Grade I house, set on the edge of historic Sherwood Forest, Thoresby Hall really is the place to come and unwind in style. Modern spa facilities & Beauty treatments, and a choice of stylish new Signature and Historic and Standard rooms. Midweek and Weekend breaks inclusive of breakfast and 3-course dining, live evening entertainment and extensive leisure activities as well as 2 Rosette a la carte restaurant.
